intro: Sideroxylon lifuanum, commonly known as the Malagasy ironwood, is a member of the Sapotaceae family. It is a large, evergreen tree native to Madagascar, characterized by its dense, heavy wood that is highly valued for its strength and durability. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape and have a smooth upper surface. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round fruits containing a single seed. The tree is adapted to the tropical climate of Madagascar and plays an important ecological role in its native habitat.
